head.citation-title: Reference sensor pattern noise with quaternion-based encryption for DICOM images
head.abstracts: Â© Research India Publications.Unwanted artifacts in DICOM images has to be suppressed to improve the quality of images. In this paper Reference SPN (Sensor Pattern Noise) is used on non-unique artifacts to reduce the false identification rate. This aims at removing periodic artifacts by detecting and suppressing the peaks. The spectrum equalization algorithm used consists of six SPN extractions, evaluated on the image. This method remains more resistant to JPEG images. After attenuation of noise a quaternion-based lossless encryption is used by modifying the DICOM network which increases the encryption speed of DICOM images. The DICOM image is decomposed in to 8-bit gray tone image which implements Feistel network and uses quaternion rotations in 3D space. Lipschitz quaternions are used to write the image. Quaternion operations are performed using modular arithmetic. The attenuated and encrypted image is obtained and computer-based analysis is performed.

translated-sourcetitle.$: International Journal of Applied Engineering Research

coredata.dc:description: Unwanted artifacts in DICOM images has to be suppressed to improve the quality of images. In this paper Reference SPN (Sensor Pattern Noise) is used on non-unique artifacts to reduce the false identification rate. This aims at removing periodic artifacts by detecting and suppressing the peaks. The spectrum equalization algorithm used consists of six SPN extractions, evaluated on the image. This method remains more resistant to JPEG images. After attenuation of noise a quaternion-based lossless encryption is used by modifying the DICOM network which increases the encryption speed of DICOM images. The DICOM image is decomposed in to 8-bit gray tone image which implements Feistel network and uses quaternion rotations in 3D space. Lipschitz quaternions are used to write the image. Quaternion operations are performed using modular arithmetic. The attenuated and encrypted image is obtained and computer-based analysis is performed.
coredata.dc:title: Reference sensor pattern noise with quaternion-based encryption for DICOM images
